Package stocks.model

Interface Portfolio

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FlexiblePortfolioImpl, InFlexiblePortfolioImpl
    public interface Portfolio
    This interface acts as model for virtual-trading application. It has implemented all trivial operations of trading like creating a portfolio by buying stocks/loading file ,getting total value of portfolio, view composition.

      • getTotalValueOfPortfolioOnCertainDate

        double getTotalValueOfPortfolioOnCertainDate​(java.lang.String date,
                                             java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Gives the valuation of the given portfolio as of a certain given date.
        Parameters:
        date - the date as of which total value needs to be calculated.
        portfolioName - the portfolio for which total value is needed.
        Returns:
        the total value calculated for given date.

      • buyStocks

        void buyStocks​(java.lang.String companyName,
               java.lang.String quantity,
               java.lang.String date,
               java.lang.String com,
               java.lang.String portfolioName)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Buy stocks of a company and add to the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        quantity - number of stocks to be bought.
        companyName - company of which stocks need to be bought.
        portfolioName - portfolio to which bought stocks need to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • sellStocks

        void sellStocks​(java.lang.String companyName,
                java.lang.String quantity,
                java.lang.String date,
                java.lang.String com,
                java.lang.String portfolioName)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        sell stocks of a company and add to the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        companyName - name of the company.
        quantity - quantity of stocks.
        date - date of transaction.
        com - commission in this transaction.
        portfolioName - name of portfolio.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - throws IllegalArgument exception when invalid input is provided.

              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Update the given portfolio.
        Parameters:
        companyName - name of the company.
        quantity - quantity of stocks.
        date - date of transaction.
        portfolioName - name of portfolio.
        action - action buy/sell
        com - commission in this transaction.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - throws IllegalArgument exception when invalid input is provided.

        companyName - name of the company.
        quantity - quantity of stocks.
        date - date of transaction.
        portfolioName - name of portfolio.
        action - action buy/sell
        com - commission in this transaction.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - throws IllegalArgument exception when invalid input is provided.

      • getTotalMoneyInvestedOnCertainDate

        double getTotalMoneyInvestedOnCertainDate​(java.lang.String date,
                                          java.lang.String portfolioName)
        Get total cost basis of the given portfolio.
        Parameters:
        date - date of cost basis req.
        portfolioName - name of portfolio.
        Returns:
        returns total amount invested till this date along with commission.

      • getPortfolioPerformanceOvertime

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Double> getPortfolioPerformanceOvertime​(java.lang.String startTime,
                                                                                       java.lang.String endTime,
                                                                                       java.lang.String portfolioName)
        get portfolioPerformance over the range of time.
        Parameters:
        startTime - start point of the range.
        endTime - end point of the range.
        portfolioName - name of the portfolio.
        Returns:
